Comment: Note that Hitler and the Nazi's operated the same way before they took over. They called for violence on groups or specific people and then denounced the people who did the violence in their name. They praised and ridiculed foreign leaders subscribing to far right ideologies as required. They lied to judges and newspapers about what they believed to play the system, safe in the knowledge that their followers expected them to do just that. Internally, they joked about how "clever" they were to dodge the legal and political consequences of their behaviour.  Hypocrisy is a virtue in the eyes of people like these. It's another form of power they have over those who play by the rules, have morals or value truth and decency. This is not just a cabal of evil people playing their followers for fools. It's an entire movement of people who reject empathy and morality as "weakness". They revel in their leaders' dishonesty, the hypocrisy and the disdain for rules and norms because they want the same things: complete freedom of conscience and consequences. They want to feel "good" even as they harm those they don't like, because it gives them a feeling of power and an emotional catharsis. And if that means they have to twist reality and morality around whatever narrative happens to suit the present situation, then they will do just that.
Author: barryvm
